PREFERENCES.TITLE: Preferences
PREFERENCES.SUBTITLE: Block settings
PREFERENCES.DEFAULT_BLACKLIST_HELP_ON: Turn this option off to see all items listed for sale.
PREFERENCES.DEFAULT_BLACKLIST_HELP_OFF: Turn this option on to hide blacklisted sellers.
PREFERENCES.BLACKLIST_ADD_TEXT: Subscribe to a 3rd party blacklist service provider:
PREFERENCES.PRIVACY_HELP_REGULAR: Regular Privacy uses a remote copy of the Ethereum blockchain, maintained by the eMercury developers. Change to High Privacy to use your own, local copy of the blockchain.
PREFERENCES.PRIVACY_HELP_HIGH: High Privacy uses your own, local copy of the Ethereum blockchain. Change to Regular Privacy to use a remote copy of the Ethereum blockchain maintained by the Block developers.
PREFERENCES.LOGIN_HELP_ON: Buying and selling requires that you log in. Turn this setting OFF to buy and sell without logging in.
PREFERENCES.LOGIN_HELP_OFF: You may buy and sell without logging in. Turn this setting ON to require logging in to buy and sell.

NEWS.TITLE: News
NEWS.SUBTITLE: The latest news about The Block

HELP.TITLE: Help
HELP.SUBTITLE: Help with The Block
HELP.Q1_TEXT: The Block is a global, encrypted online marketplace where you can buy and sell with privacy.
HELP.Q2_TEXT: The listing fee for an item is XXX Ether, or approximately USD 0.50. Unlike other popular markets. no extra fees are taken from your final sale price.
HELP.Q3_HEADER: How can I refill my wallet?
HELP.Q3_TEXT: It is possible to fill or refill your Wallet in two ways. Once you have created your Wallet, you may either send Ether to it directly, or you may buy Ether from within the Wallet, using Bitcoin.
HELP.Q5_TEXT: BitBoost does not encourage the sale of illegal items. However, the world is a big place, and not every item is illegal, or legal, in every jurisdiction. The Terms of Use simply require that you comply with your local laws, which is your responsibility.
HELP.Q6_HEADER: Can I use BTC or other coins?
HELP.Q6_TEXT: Not at the moment. However, you may buy Ether using Bitcoin from within your Block Wallet. We are investigating how to bring support for buying and getting paid with more coins, including Bitcoin.
HELP.Q7_HEADER: What if I lose my password?
HELP.Q7_TEXT: Your password is important. Do not lose or forget your password, or you will be unable to access your Ether. The developers cannot help you if you lose your password, so be careful.
HELP.Q8_TEXT: Blacklisting is a way for us to control which items you see in The Block. There is no censorship in The Block, but some items are filtered from view by default through blacklisting. Blacklisting is turned on by default, but it is possible for you to turn it off if you want to see a completely unfiltered view of all items available in The Block.
HELP.Q9_HEADER: How do I turn blacklisting on/off?
HELP.Q9_TEXT: Blacklisting controls are in the Preferences section of the application.
HELP.Q10_TEXT: While the developers provide a single, default blacklist, it is possible for you to subscribe to more than one list. For example, you may wish to subscribe to a list that only filters out items that are illegal in your jurisdiction, or that are inappropriate for children, or that are forbidden by your religion. We hope that list providers will make a wide variety of third-party lists available.
